Prey: Scorpions, insects, grasshoppers, crickets, and kangaroo rats
Fun Fact: The grasshopper mice attack predators using the poison of their venom.
Most Distinctive Feature: Furry bodies and sometimes fat tails
Litter Size: 2-6, though most litters are just 4 pups
Habitat: Grasslands, elevated areas, and deserted scrubs
Lifespan: The lifespan is only about a few weeks or months in the wild
Height: Body - 3.5 to 5 inches, tail – 1 to 2.5 inches
Length: Body - 3.5 to 5 inches, tail – 1 to 2.5 inches
Name: Grasshopper Mouse
